ratings.comment: John is my favorite prof at UW! He is super caring and fun to learn from. I spent a lot of time with John because my class was only 18 students and involved an intense study abroad, and John is not a professor that becomes boring over time. He is eager to help and understanding.
JZ is amazing. So thoughtful. So smart. So willing to help you always.

JZ is an awesome professor who is super considerate and caring of all his students. I had him in a 8am class and he brought bagels and donuts pretty frequently because he knows how much 8am class sucks. He was always willing to meet outside of class. Everything he did was engaging and it made my first semester easy to ease into.

Zumbrunnen is interesting and engaging, tries to connect with students. Tends to get sidetracked by students. Class was very elementary, first half of lecture was spent reviewing material from the previous lecture. Weekly online quizzes and three short papers due throughout semester, no final exam.
Great lectures and very accessible outside of class with questions in which hes very willing to meet and talk. If you get the chance, take a course and get to know him! Hes a great guy.

He opens the class up to waaay too much discussion. What ended up happening in my class was that the same few kids took this time for their own personal philosophy or just to show off and it was really annoying. And he encourages it. We ended up talking about stuff totally irrelevant to the class and kids always left early. Not what I paid for.

Incredible professor with extensive subject knowledge! He makes his lectures go fast by combining informative video clips, funny stories, and group discussions. He is clear in his grading criteria and usually picks good TA's. I would absolutely recommend him to anyone exploring or majoring in political science.

John was my professor for this class and Poli Sci 100. He is not a tough grader, but his TA's can be. He is sincerely interested in his students and really wants to make sure you walk out with something new. He is great!

One of my favorite professors. Get to know him one on one! He is a fun guy who loves his subject and his students. Very knowledgable and provides thought-provoking lectures. Really enjoyed him and would recommend him to anyone.

Had him a couple of years ago and still remember how amazing he was. Had him for a FIG and loved him so much that I begged my way into his upper level theory class. Fun, smart, approachable. I learned a lot, and if you do the work it's not hard to get a good grade.

You need to take this class. His lectures were great and he kept a power lecture short by cracking jokes. Don't read. There's two long papers and some short writing assignments that are easy A's, and some quizzes that are simple. It's an easy A if you show up to class and try on the essays. My first essay was graded way harder than the second.

Zumbrunnen is a really great professor. You'll learn a lot about his family and his dogs. Personally I really like his back stories, it keeps the class interesting and he ties it into the material really nicely sometimes. He also managed to boil down really complex theoretical concepts into understandable portions.

One of the best professors I've had at UW. Explains everything incredibly well and wants his students to succeed and leave with a knowledge of important political ideas. Lectures are interesting and he does everything he can to make them as fun as possible. Take PS209 with him if you can.

John is one of the best professors I have ever had. He makes the subject matter, even if it's boring, seem very interesting and explains things so well that difficult concepts become almost perfectly clear by the end of lecture. He is also hilarious, and students really like him! Bi-weekly quizzes are very fair and TAs are caring and helpful.
This man is a saint. Even if you have no interest in political science, he works with you and pushes you. He is awesome and I am so happy I took a class with him!

Best professor I have ever had. It shows that he is really passionate about what he does. His lectures are crystal clear, incredibly interesting, and he always took the time to make sure we understood the material. I really looked forward to lecture every week. Kristen was an awesome TA too.

Awesome Professor! It may be hard to get up early every M/W, but trust me, it is a MUST GO. I barely read the textbook because John was so knowledgable, clear, and to point about everything we needed to know. Great examples, quotes, and stresses on important materials. Only downside is that the TA's grade your stuff completely. Write for your TA.
Amazing teacher! Don't need to buy the book!!!  So helpful and knows what he's talking about!  Really understanding nice guy

Never read the textbook. He explained everything really well. His lectures were always interesting, and he kept your attention. Tests were fair. Our final wound up being online because of snow, but it was a bit tougher than the midterms.
Easily my favorite professor. Great guy; funny. Didn't read textbook once; he goes over everything in lecture.

Professor is extremely knowledgable, friendly, and entertaining. Makes an otherwise dull subject bearable. Exams are short answer/essay, graded by TAs, no other assignments/grades besides participation. Lecture not mandatory but you will not succeed in class unless you attend and take VERY DETAILED notes. Recommend to anyone look for theory credits

Favorite professor so far, the lectures would be really boring with someone else teaching it. He keeps it interesting and easy to understand. The tests are pretty straight forward as long as you attend lecture and take good notes. I barely use my textbook, the readings are boring and long, but he does such a good job in lecture.

Favorite professor by far. He is extremely entertaining and wants you to do well. Everything you need to know for the exam he explains in class and lays it out for you. No need to read the text because he fully explains the text as long as you go to lecture. The only downside is the TA's grade everything.

He makes the class fun and is a very clear in lecture.  Everything you need to know about the reading is covered when he lectures.  However, I would advise taking really good notes.  He lays out everyting you need to know clearly but his slides are mainly just quotes and its hard to go back and figure out what he wanted you to get out of them
A good guy, though I got the sense it was pretty tough to get an A. Covers just about everything you need to know in lecture, which is good because some of the readings can be pretty dense.

I enjoyed this professor a lot, getting up at 8:50 was worth his humor and friendly demeanor. However, there was a great disparity among his TA's. The female TA, Kaitlyn Jones was much more difficult/unfair than the other TA. TA's grade everything.

Really entertaining and easy to talk to. Made class fun and interesting. Didn't need readings to understand class but it helped to do them. Assignment instructions were really clear. Awesome guy who really knows how to connect with college kids. Very chill class.

Great professor. I had no poli sci classes prior and understood everything. The readings seem daunting and hard to understand but you basically don't have to read anything because he explains the material so well. Very entertaining and engaging.
Great Prof
Great Professor.  Cares that you learn the material and why it matters.  Not hard, but you should definitely do the work because you will benifit immensely from the insights he brings to it.

Such a fun lecturer. He always tells funny stories to make the boring topic of political theory enjoyable. He tries really hard to make lectures enjoyable. Great professor definitely take a class from him. The final is a paper so makes it even better!
Good teacher, funny guy. Probably an even better teacher for people who have the slightest interest in political science, which definitely was/is not me.

Zumbrunnen is a really great lecturer; he's interesting and funny.  The class has a lot of reading but all the important concepts that you will be tested on he reviews during class so it isn't necessary to read to get a good grade.  There are 2 midterms, a final paper, and 3 1-2 reflection papers.  Not a super hard class.

Good teacher. He doesn't try to trick students on the tests and the course is taught at a leisurely pace. He's also technologically literate (for the most part) and he likes to integrate videos into lectures to give historical or personal context to the material.
Very entertaining teacher, class not too difficult

I don't care what anyone else says- if you want an A, you need to read the books. The concepts are difficult and Machiavelli sucks, but just memorize the study guide answers (which take a lifetime to write up) by heart. Best part is John keeps the class upbeat (even with the really dry material) and responds to any question on study guide via email

Class runs with PoliSci 502 so I was overwhelmed at first. No need to due readings, but lecture is mandatory. He tells you all the important things from readings. Very interesting class, and GREAT teacher.

Great professor, really knows what he is talking about. The subject material for the class is pretty boring and at times confusing, but he made it all clear in lecture. 2 papers and 2 exams, all doable, but go to lecture!! You will be lost without good notes! Don't bother doing the readings, its really not necessary.

Amazing professor. Class topic would have been extremely boring with anyone else but he was funny, engaging, and interesting.  He was easy to understand and laid out all the concepts clearly.  Not too much work since you don't really need to do the readings.  The class wasn't too hard, either.  Very helpful.  Highly, highly recommended.
